intro: Nematanthus crassifolius subsp. chloronema, commonly known as the greenleaf waxplant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are typically green to bluish-green in color. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in hue. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
